result.execSummary:
The defendant Donald Dean Wood was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
Pay restitution in the amount of $1,153.20 to Robert Barton. 
25% of all moneys deposited into the defendants prison account shall be applied to the payment of fines, costs & restitution in this file.  If any fines, costs & restitution remain outstanding at the end of the confinement portion of this sentence, then the remaining balances shall be paid as a condition of extended supervision.
Pay all court ordered financial obligations in full 90 days prior to discharge.

Do not have direct/indirect contact with the following persons/places:  Robert Barton or Richard Wilson.
Maintain absolute sobriety for the duration of supervision.
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription.
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.

Comply with other assessments, treatment, and programming as deemed appropriate by the Compass Assessment and the Department of Corrections.
Provide DNA for testing. 
Comply with substance abuse programming.

copy
Sentencing hearing held 10/7/2015
Associated with Charge #1

Defendant Donald Dean Wood in court with attorney Gary J. Kryshak. Defendant Donald Dean Wood in custody. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

10:04 a.m.  Court calls case.
Atty Cousins states the appearances.
Atty Cousins indicates that this will be an arguing sentencing and is prepared to do so.

Court and counsel have received their copies of the PSI.
Court questions if any correction need to be made on the record.
Atty Kryshak indicates no corrections to be made on the PSI.
Prosecutor argues regarding sentencing.
Attorney for Defendant argues regarding sentencing.
Defendant does not wish to make a statement prior to sentencing.

BY THE COURT:
Count 1 -
38 month prison sentence with 18 months initial confinement and 20 months extended supervision
Do not have direct/indirect contact with the following persons/places:  Robert Barton or Richard Wilson
Maintain absolute sobriety for the duration of supervision
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription.
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
AODA & comply with treatment recommendations.
Comply with other assessments, treatment, and programming as deemed appropriate by the Compass Assessment and the Department of Corrections.
Pay all court ordered financial obligations in full 90 days prior to discharge.
Pay restitution in the amount of $1,153.20 to Robert Barton.
If sentenced to prison, pay restitution out of prison wages.
Provide DNA for testing.
Eligible for Substance Abuse Program (Earned Release) and Challenge Incarceration.
Comply with substance abuse programming
146 days of Jail Credit

Count 2 - DRI

**Appeal rights to be provided
Atty Kryshak
/s/Judge Zappen
Sentencing hearing at 10-07-2015 10:00 am

Defendant Donald Dean Wood in court with attorney Anne Renc. Defendant Donald Dean Wood in custody. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

2:22 PM Court calls case.
Court states appearances.

Atty Cousins addresses the Court, matter is set for a plea today.
Defendant is pleading to Count 1. Count 2 dismissed and read in
State requests a PSI.
State caps recommendation at 18 mo initial confinement, 2 yrs extended supervision, restitution of $1,153.20, among other conditions that will be argued.

State has complied with victim notification stautes.

Atty Renc concurs.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.

Defendant enters a plea of: NO CONTEST Count 1.

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court reviews the facts of the case.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney Renc for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulation there is factual basis to support the charge.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge.
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
Count 1: Take and Drive Vehicle without Consent
Count 2: Dismissed and Read In

BY THE COURT:
Court orders a PSI be conducted with report to be returned to the Court. 

Parties are to set a date with Judicial Assistant.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 08-04-2015 02:00 pm
Jury trial - 12 person at 07-29-2015 08:30 am
Pre-trial conference at 06-29-2015 11:00 am
Pre-trial conference at 06-15-2015 11:00 am

State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY Plea(s) entered.

Bond Continued.

Defendant Donald Dean Wood in court with attorney Anne Renc. Defendant Donald Dean Wood in custody. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives right to Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions the Defendant regarding Waiver of Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions Defendant's attorney.
Court finds the Defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the Preliminary Hearing.
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 

Bond Continued  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 15, 2015 at 11:00 am.
for Modification of Bond

Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.

d.o.b. 02-25-1988
1:24 p.m.  Court calls case.
ADA Molepske appears in Court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video.

ADA Molepske states facts for anticipated charges of Take and Drive Vehicle w/out Consent and Resisting or Obstructing and Officer.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.
Court informs Defendant right to an attorney and/or Public Defender.
Court questions Defendant. 
State requests a cash bond of $10,000.00 with conditions as stated.
Defendant makes statements. 
Defendant states that he is residing with his father in Merrill, WI; even though when apprehended he indicated that his address was an Oklahoma address.

Initial Appearance Scheduled for:   June 1, 2015 @ 1:30 p.m.  in Branch 3.
